{"step_by_step_thinking": "The relevant documents mention injuries to the proximal interphalangeal joint of the fingers. Among these, closed rupture of both flexor tendons in the same digit is mentioned. The case described involved a patient who sustained a closed rupture of both flexor digitorum profundus and flexor digitorum superficialis of the ring finger. This suggests that Jersey finger, which is caused by rupture of flexor tendons, specifically the deep or superficial flexor tendon of a finger, is likely related to the rupture of one or both of these tendons.", "answer_choice": B}
